name: Best-boundary threshold
description:
Automatic thresholding, where threshold leads to maximal value of
    min(Sblack, Swhite) / (α(N + M) + P)γ
Sblack / Swhite is the number of pixels under/over the threshold (black or white in the resulting binary matrix), N×M are the dimensions of the matrix, P is the length of the boundary between black and white areas, α and γ are the parameters specified below. By default α=γ=1, that means search for minimal boundary in comparison with area of the object/background or, in other words, the maximal "thickness" of the found objects

controls.name: alpha
controls.caption: α (addition)
controls.description: α parameter (see description of the function). Non-zero value increases stability of behaviour.

controls.name: gamma
controls.caption: γ (exponent)
controls.description: γ parameter: exponent for boundary length (see description of the function). Values >1 (like 2) can be useful to find threshold for images containing boundaries between objects instead of objects themselves.
